author: __flcl
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/426
A small update to isolate engine_*payloadV3 API even more and cover some undefined cases. Wdyt?
Also cc: <@425572898787426305> <@892053833121923094>

author: m.kalinin
content: I really appreciate cleanups that this PR makes to Cancun spec, but i would not touch Paris at all

author: __flcl
content: It's just to cover the case when engine_newPayloadV1 receives payload with the correct V1 set of params, but with post-Cancun timestamp. Fully open to other ideas.

author: m.kalinin
content: Actually, V1 should only be used for pre-Shanghai payloads. I like the intention but i am not sure if it makes sense to change the spec that is final as devs unlikely to make it into their codebase (only those who are developing a new client will do that for sure). I was thinking about the way to backdate this type of constraint whenever we introduce a new fork and didn't come to any solution other than changing the spec for the previous fork which doesn't seem to take any effect, IMHO

author: __flcl
content:
I see, but we are lucky to have a bit similar case already in the spec! https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/cancun.md#deprecate-engine_exchangetransitionconfigurationv1
We can mention such V1 update in Cancun in the same way

author: m.kalinin
content: It is a good idea, actually!
